item.title: Access API examples
item.description: Access API examplesAccess users can create policies, including individual rule blocks inside of group or policy bodies. For example, this policy allows all Cloudflare email account users to reach the application with the exception of one account: { "name": "allow cloudflare employees", "decision": "allow", "include": [ { "email_domain": { "domain": "cloudflare.com" } } ], "exclude": [ { "email": { "email": "notthisperson@cloudflare.com" } } ], "require": [] } ​​ Example rule configurations These are commonly used rule configurations.

item.title: Scoped API tokens
item.description: Scoped API tokensThe administrators managing policies and groups in Cloudflare Access might be different from the users responsible for configuring firewall rules or other Cloudflare for Infrastructure settings. Cloudflare Access supports scoped API tokens External link icon Open external link so that team members and automated systems can manage settings specific to Access without having permission to modify other configurations in Cloudflare. ​​ Creating a scoped API token In the Cloudflare for Infrastructure External link icon Open external link dashboard, click the user icon in the top right and navigate to “My Profile”.
